faq.a1: BabyLook is a mobile application that uses artificial intelligence to predict the appearance of your future child based on ultrasound scans and parent photos.
faq.a10: Usually 30-45 seconds, depending on:Quality of uploaded imagesInternet speedAI server load
faq.a11: Yes! New users receive:2 free generations upon registrationWeekly free generation for active users
faq.a14: Use clear, well-lit photosSpecify exact pregnancy termUpload frontal parent photosUse photos without glasses or headwearInclude additional information in notes
faq.a15: Yes! Our AI is trained on diverse data and considers:Ethnic characteristicsRegional facial traitsGenetic population characteristics
faq.a2: The application analyzes:Baby's ultrasound scanFather and mother's photosAdditional information (pregnancy term, gender)Then the AI creates a realistic image of what your child might look like after birth.
faq.a3: Prediction accuracy is ~70-85% for major facial features. However, this is an entertainment application and results may differ from reality. Every child is unique!
faq.a4: We use advanced AI models from Google Gemini, specifically trained to analyze genetic traits and create realistic images.
faq.a6: Yes, internet connection is required for predictions as processing occurs on powerful AI servers.
faq.a7: Recommended scans:24-32 weeks of pregnancy - facial features are more visibleClear, well-lit imagesFrontal or profile view of baby's face
faq.a8: No, you can upload:Ultrasound + one parent onlyJust ultrasoundUltrasound + both parents (recommended for best results)
faq.a9: Yes, you can specify:BoyGirlDon't know (AI will consider both variants)
faq.q14: How to get the best result?
faq.q7: What ultrasound scan should I upload?
faq.q8: Do I need to upload both parents' photos?
faq.q9: Can I change the baby's gender in the app?

fun_fact.fact1: 70% probability - the child will inherit the shape of the lips from the mother
fun_fact.fact10: 30% of children inherit their father's smile, even if they resemble their mother.
fun_fact.fact11: In 20% of cases, the child inherits a combination of traits that neither parent possesses.
fun_fact.fact12: 10% of children are born with an exact copy of a mole in the same place as their parent.
fun_fact.fact13: 70% of sons inherit their mother's facial shape.
fun_fact.fact14: 80% of daughters inherit their father's hair texture.
fun_fact.fact15: 60% of boys inherit their mother's eye color.
fun_fact.fact16: 90% of girls inherit their ear shape from their father.
fun_fact.fact17: 50% probability - the first child will resemble the father, the second - the mother
fun_fact.fact19: 3 generations - maximum ‚Äòmemory‚Äô of genes about the appearance of ancestors
fun_fact.fact2: There is a 60% chance of having dimples on your cheeks if one of your parents has them.
fun_fact.fact20: 1 in 10 couples have a child who does not resemble either of them.
fun_fact.fact21: 85% of parents see their own traits in their children, even if they don't have them.
fun_fact.fact22: 70% of grandmothers say their grandson resembles their side of the family.
fun_fact.fact23: 60% of fathers see their son as a ‚Äòminiature version of themselves‚Äô.
fun_fact.fact3: 90% probability of inheriting the shape of the nose from one of the parents
fun_fact.fact4: 75% of children inherit their hair color from their father.
fun_fact.fact5: In 80% of cases, brown eyes win over blue eyes (dominant gene).
fun_fact.fact6: 90% probability - curly hair dominates over straight hair
fun_fact.fact7: 85% chance - dimple on the chin will be passed from father to son
fun_fact.fact8: 70% of children inherit their eyebrow shape from their mother.
fun_fact.fact9: One in four children are born looking like their grandmother or grandfather, bypassing their parents.

step1.choose_an_image_showing_the_baby: Choose an image showing the baby's profile clearly
step1.ensure_ultrasound_image: Ensure the ultrasound image is well-lit and not blurry
step1.note: Your ultrasound image is processed securely and never stored after prediction generation.
step1.use_your_most_recent_ultrasound: Use your most recent ultrasound for best accuracy

step2.choose_the_baby_gender: Choose the baby's gender or select if you don't know yet
step2.note: This information helps our AI provide more accurate predictions tailored to your baby's development stage.
step2.select_the_current_week: Select the current week of pregnancy
step2.tip_subtitle: Weeks 24-28 provide the clearest ultrasound images for AI analysis.

step3.clear_frontal_photo_for_best_result: Clear frontal photo for best results
step3.ensure_face: Ensure face is clearly visible and in focus
step3.natural_expression_note: Neutral or natural expression works best
step3.note: Both parent photos are required to generate an accurate prediction
step3.position_face_to_fill: Position face to fill most of the frame
step3.tip: Tip! Frontal photos with neutral backgrounds work best for accurate predictions
step3.upload_parent_photo_note: Clear photos of both parents help our AI generate a more accurate baby prediction
step3.use_natural_light: Use natural light or well-lit indoor environment
